NewsItems.Summary: The AMLOcl Editor Plugin is released to be used with licensed editor versions 6.1.6 and beyond.

Links.LinkTarget: AutomationML Editor Plugin AMLOcl on NUGET

NewsItems.Summary: There are new wiki pages with explanatory videos for some specific editor functions.

Links.LinkTarget: Editing of external data references
Working with AutomationML containers
Splitting and Merging

NewsItems.Summary: Version 4.4.2 of the Aml.Engine provides a new extension method to serialize a user defined class into a CAEX `AdditionalInformation` element.
NewsItems.More: If a class is to be added to a CAEX object, this can be done by serializing the class in the AdditionalInformation element of a suitable CAEX object. The AmlEngine now offers a new extension method for this. An example is published in the engine repository.

Links.LinkTarget: Example Implementation to serialize classes to AdditionalInformation Elements

NewsItems.Summary: A sandbox repository to support the plugin development for AutomationML editor version 6.0 and higher is now available.
NewsItems.More: Please note that both the version for the editor in version 5 and the new version for the editor in version 6 are offered.

Links.LinkTarget: AutomationML Editor PlugIn Development

NewsItems.More: The API online documentation has moved to a new web location and there are brand new wiki pages with more code examples (see below).

Links.LinkTarget: AutomationML Engine API Reference Guide
Picture of the complete CAEX Class Model

NewsItems.Summary: You are invited to share your ideas or proposals for new features of the AutomationML editor in a new discussion forum provided by GitHub.

Links.LinkTarget: AutomationML Editor Discussion Group

NewsItems.Summary: The AML Engine repository on GitHub now contains a complete API documentation and a new Wiki.

Aml.Engine Wiki on GitHub

NewsItems.Summary: The project page for the development of plugins for the AutomationML editor has been updated. The sample implementations include a procedure for plugin deployment under NUGET.

Links.LinkTarget: Aml.Engine.Plugin project on GitHub.

NewsItems.Summary: PlugIn developers can test the integration of their own PlugIns from a local Nuget folder before publishing them to the NUGET platform. The procedure can be followed in the development environment for PlugIns.

Links.LinkTarget: AutomationML Editor PlugIn Resources on GitHub

NewsItems.More: AutomationML provides sample implementations for basic technologies and methods that can be used to work with XML-based data models.

Links.LinkTarget: Example code of the AML Book
Git repository of the AMLEngine with sample code
AutomationML cook book chapter about AML software development.

NewsItems.More: The AutomationML Icon Library will be used in the next version of the AutomationML Editor (v. 5.5.0). Compared to previous versions, this one is more readable and easier to integrate into software. All icons are vector graphics and available in different formats (.svg, .png, .pdf, .xaml).

Links.LinkTarget: AutomationML Icon Library
